Summary statistics of a numeric array.

eda.stats.Rd

Generates summary statistics of mean, median, skew, kurtosis, min, max and quartiles. 

eda.stats(x)

Arguments

x

numeric array

Details

requires timeDate library

Value

Named list with the following items:

summary

min, 1st quartile, median, mean, 3rd quartile, max

skew

skewness

kurt

kurtosis

%% ~Describe the value returned %% If it is a LIST, use %% \item{comp1 }{Description of 'comp1'} %% \item{comp2 }{Description of 'comp2'} %% ...

Author

Garry Grabow

See also

eda.shape, summary,skewness, kurtosis

Examples

require(timeDate)

#> Loading required package: timeDate
# summary statistics for random normal data
# mean of 1. sd = 0.3
ndata<-rnorm(25,1,.3)
eda.stats(ndata)

#> $summary
#>    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
#>  0.4265  0.9060  0.9952  0.9915  1.0731  1.8266 
#> 
#> $skew
#> [1] 0.4021268
#> attr(,"method")
#> [1] "moment"
#> 
#> $kurt
#> [1] 0.8199161
#> attr(,"method")
#> [1] "excess"
#> 
#summary statistics for right-skewed data
#mean of 1, sd=1
rdata<-rexp(25,rate=1)
eda.stats(rdata)

#> $summary
#>     Min.  1st Qu.   Median     Mean  3rd Qu.     Max. 
#> 0.007957 0.175364 0.374895 0.616205 0.671105 2.193512 
#> 
#> $skew
#> [1] 1.117975
#> attr(,"method")
#> [1] "moment"
#> 
#> $kurt
#> [1] -0.06542477
#> attr(,"method")
#> [1] "excess"
#>
